speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS, OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And can you, by no drift of circumstance,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Get from him why he puts on this confusion,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Grating so harshly all his days of quiet

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With turbulent and dangerous lunacy?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: He does confess he feels himself distracted;

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: But from what cause he will by no means speak.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Nor do we find him forward to be sounded,

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: But, with a crafty madness, keeps aloof,

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: When we would bring him on to some confession

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Of his true state.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Did he receive you well?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Most like a gentleman.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: But with much forcing of his disposition.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Niggard of question; but, of our demands,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Most free in his reply.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Did you assay him?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To any pastime?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Madam, it so fell out, that certain players

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: We o'er-raught on the way: of these we told him;

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: And there did seem in him a kind of joy

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: To hear of it: they are about the court,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: And, as I think, they have already order

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: This night to play before him.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: 'Tis most true:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And he beseech'd me to entreat your majesties

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To hear and see the matter.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With all my heart; and it doth much content me

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To hear him so inclined.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Good gentlemen, give him a further edge,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And drive his purpose on to these delights.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: We shall, my lord.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Sweet Gertrude, leave us too;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For we have closely sent for Hamlet hither,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That he, as 'twere by accident, may here

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Affront Ophelia:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Her father and myself, lawful espials,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will so bestow ourselves that, seeing, unseen,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We may of their encounter frankly judge,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And gather by him, as he is behaved,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If 't be the affliction of his love or no

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That thus he suffers for.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I shall obey you.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And for your part, Ophelia, I do wish

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That your good beauties be the happy cause

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Of Hamlet's wildness: so shall I hope your virtues

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Will bring him to his wonted way again,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To both your honours.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Madam, I wish it may.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Exit QUEEN GERTRUDE

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Ophelia, walk you here. Gracious, so please you,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: We will bestow ourselves.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To OPHELIA

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Read on this book;

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: That show of such an exercise may colour

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Your loneliness. We are oft to blame in this,--

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: 'Tis too much proved--that with devotion's visage

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And pious action we do sugar o'er

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: The devil himself.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: [Aside]          O, 'tis too true!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How smart a lash that speech doth give my conscience!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The harlot's cheek, beautied with plastering art,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Is not more ugly to the thing that helps it

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Than is my deed to my most painted word:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O heavy burthen!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I hear him coming: let's withdraw, my lord.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Exeunt KING CLAUDIUS and POLONIUS

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To be, or not to be: that is the question:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No more; and by a sleep to say we end

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That flesh is heir to, 'tis a consummation

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Devoutly to be wish'd. To die, to sleep;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there's the rub;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For in that sleep of death what dreams may come

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When we have shuffled off this mortal coil,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Must give us pause: there's the respect

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That makes calamity of so long life;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For who would bear the whips and scorns of time,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The oppressor's wrong, the proud man's contumely,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The pangs of despised love, the law's delay,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The insolence of office and the spurns

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That patient merit of the unworthy takes,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When he himself might his quietus make

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With a bare bodkin? who would fardels bear,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To grunt and sweat under a weary life,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But that the dread of something after death,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The undiscover'd country from whose bourn

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No traveller returns, puzzles the will

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And makes us rather bear those ills we have

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Than fly to others that we know not of?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thus conscience does make cowards of us all;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And thus the native hue of resolution

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And enterprises of great pith and moment

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With this regard their currents turn awry,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And lose the name of action.--Soft you now!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The fair Ophelia! Nymph, in thy orisons

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be all my sins remember'd.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: How does your honour for this many a day?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I humbly thank you; well, well, well.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: My lord, I have remembrances of yours,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: That I have longed long to re-deliver;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: I pray you, now receive them.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, not I;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I never gave you aught.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: My honour'd lord, you know right well you did;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And, with them, words of so sweet breath composed

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: As made the things more rich: their perfume lost,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Take these again; for to the noble mind

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Rich gifts wax poor when givers prove unkind.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: There, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ha, ha! are you honest?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Are you fair?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: What means your lordship?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That if you be honest and fair, your honesty should

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: admit no discourse to your beauty.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Could beauty, my lord, have better commerce than

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: with honesty?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, truly; for the power of beauty will sooner

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: transform honesty from what it is to a bawd than the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: force of honesty can translate beauty into his

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: likeness: this was sometime a paradox, but now the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: time gives it proof. I did love you once.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Indeed, my lord, you made me believe so.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You should not have believed me; for virtue cannot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: so inoculate our old stock but we shall relish of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: it: I loved you not.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: I was the more deceived.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Get thee to a nunnery: why wouldst thou be a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: breeder of sinners? I am myself indifferent honest;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: but yet I could accuse me of such things that it

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: were better my mother had not borne me: I am very

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: proud, revengeful, ambitious, with more offences at

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: my beck than I have thoughts to put them in,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: imagination to give them shape, or time to act them

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: in. What should such fellows as I do crawling

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: between earth and heaven? We are arrant knaves,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: all; believe none of us. Go thy ways to a nunnery.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where's your father?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: At home, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let the doors be shut upon him, that he may play the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: fool no where but in's own house. Farewell.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: O, help him, you sweet heavens!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If thou dost marry, I'll give thee this plague for

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: thy dowry: be thou as chaste as ice, as pure as

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: snow, thou shalt not escape calumny. Get thee to a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: nunnery, go: farewell. Or, if thou wilt needs

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: marry, marry a fool; for wise men know well enough

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: what monsters you make of them. To a nunnery, go,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: and quickly too. Farewell.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: O heavenly powers, restore him!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I have heard of your paintings too, well enough; God

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: has given you one face, and you make yourselves

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: another: you jig, you amble, and you lisp, and

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: nick-name God's creatures, and make your wantonness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: your ignorance. Go to, I'll no more on't; it hath

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: made me mad. I say, we will have no more marriages:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: those that are married already, all but one, shall

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: live; the rest shall keep as they are. To a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: nunnery, go.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: O, what a noble mind is here o'erthrown!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: The courtier's, soldier's, scholar's, eye, tongue, sword;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: The expectancy and rose of the fair state,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: The glass of fashion and the mould of form,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: The observed of all observers, quite, quite down!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And I, of ladies most deject and wretched,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: That suck'd the honey of his music vows,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Now see that noble and most sovereign reason,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Like sweet bells jangled, out of tune and harsh;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: That unmatch'd form and feature of blown youth

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Blasted with ecstasy: O, woe is me,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: To have seen what I have seen, see what I see!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Re-enter KING CLAUDIUS and POLONIUS

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Love! his affections do not that way tend;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Nor what he spake, though it lack'd form a little,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Was not like madness. There's something in his soul,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O'er which his melancholy sits on brood;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And I do doubt the hatch and the disclose

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will be some danger: which for to prevent,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I have in quick determination

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thus set it down: he shall with speed to England,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For the demand of our neglected tribute

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Haply the seas and countries different

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With variable objects shall expel

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: This something-settled matter in his heart,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Whereon his brains still beating puts him thus

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: From fashion of himself. What think you on't?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: It shall do well: but yet do I believe

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: The origin and commencement of his grief

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Sprung from neglected love. How now, Ophelia!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: You need not tell us what Lord Hamlet said;

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: We heard it all. My lord, do as you please;

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: But, if you hold it fit, after the play

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Let his queen mother all alone entreat him

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To show his grief: let her be round with him;

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And I'll be placed, so please you, in the ear

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Of all their conference. If she find him not,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To England send him, or confine him where

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Your wisdom best shall think.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It shall be so:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Madness in great ones must not unwatch'd go.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
